intro: Stackhousia virgata var. typica, commonly known as the slender stackhousia, is a shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to dry, sunny conditions. It is often found in fynbos vegetation, contributing to the floral diversity of the region. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden planting in suitable climates.
